author: chron.com
title: Lady Gaga landed cool place to stay in Houston -
text:
Photo: DOUG MILLS, NYT Image 1 of / 15 15 Lady Gaga found a short-term place to stay while in Houston. Lady Gaga, who will be performing at halftime of Super Bowl LI on Feb. 5, 2017, found a sweet place to stay while in Houston for the game. Lady Gaga found a short-term place to stay while in Houston. Lady Gaga, who will be performing at halftime of Super Bowl LI on Feb. 5, 2017, found a sweet place to stay while in Houston for the game. Photo: DOUG MILLS, NYT Image 2 of 15 Instagram Lady Gaga couldn't resist posting about her temporary home in Houston for Super Bowl on her Instagram page. "Houston, you are beautiful," she wrote. Instagram Lady Gaga couldn't resist posting about her temporary home in Houston for Super Bowl on her Instagram page. "Houston, you are beautiful," she wrote. Photo: Instagram Image 3 of 15 For sale Lady Gaga's pad where she stayed in Houston prior to Super Bowl LI can be had for more than $7 million or $45,000 a month. Beats a hotel in the suburbs. >>>Click through the gallery to see Lady Gaga modeling as well as the most memorable Super Bowl halftime shows. less For sale Lady Gaga's pad where she stayed in Houston prior to Super Bowl LI can be had for more than $7 million or $45,000 a month. There have been 50 years of Super Bowl games and over the past few decades, the half-time performances have gotten more and more memorable.
Continue clicking to read about our picks for the most memorable half-time shows ever. less Most memorable half-time shows ever
There have been 50 years of Super Bowl games and over the past few decades, the half-time performances have gotten more and more memorable.
Continue clicking to read about our ... more Photo: Charlie Riedel, AP Image 5 of 15 Michael Jackson
The 1990s were not an easy decade for the wacky celeb, but the “Thriller” singer’s 1993 Super Bowl appearance was one that was certainly well-remembered. For The Win once ranked it as the greatest halftime performance in Super Bowl history. less Michael Jackson
The 1990s were not an easy decade for the wacky celeb, but the “Thriller” singer’s 1993 Super Bowl appearance was one that was certainly well-remembered. For The Win once ranked it as ... more Photo: Rusty Kennedy, STF Image 6 of 15 Michael Jackson
On stage, Jackson sported a gold bandolier -- not unlike the one Beyoncé sported at Super Bowl 50 -- and opened by standing almost entirely still for nearly two minutes before breaking out into song. Once the performance started, everyone remembered why he was crowned King of Pop. less Michael Jackson
On stage, Jackson sported a gold bandolier -- not unlike the one Beyoncé sported at Super Bowl 50 -- and opened by standing almost entirely still for nearly two minutes before breaking out ... more Photo: Mike Powell, Getty Images Image 7 of 15 Prince
In 2007, Prince became the reigning champion of the halftime show. The New York Times praised it as “one of the most thrilling halftime shows ever.” Prince
In 2007, Prince became the reigning champion of the halftime show. The New York Times praised it as “one of the most thrilling halftime shows ever.” Photo: Bob Sheer, NFL Image 8 of 15 Prince
The set list included pieces of his own hits as well as unexpected covers of other artists, including everything from Creedence Clearwater Revival’s “Proud Mary” to Bob Dylan’s “All Along the Watchtower” to the Foo Fighters’ “Best of You.”
Between the smoke and the lights and the glitter, the “Purple Rain” singer wowed the crowd and the millions watching on TV. less Prince
The set list included pieces of his own hits as well as unexpected covers of other artists, including everything from Creedence Clearwater Revival’s “Proud Mary” to Bob Dylan’s “All Along the ... more Photo: Chris O'Meara, STF Image 9 of 15 Janet Jackson and Justin Timberlake
Janet Jackson and Justin Timberlake rocked the halftime show at the 2004 Super Bowl. More than a decade later, no one remembers -- or cares -- what they sang or how they danced. By far, the most memorable moment was the so-called wardrobe malfunction. less Janet Jackson and Justin Timberlake
Janet Jackson and Justin Timberlake rocked the halftime show at the 2004 Super Bowl. More than a decade later, no one remembers -- or cares -- what they sang or how they ... more Photo: LIONEL HAHN, KRT Image 10 of 15 Janet Jackson and Justin Timberlake
During the performance, the “Cry Me a River” singer supposedly accidentally ripped his fellow performer’s outfit, exposing her breast to the crowd in a mishap later known as "Nipplegate."
"What occurred was unintentional, completely regrettable, and I apologize if you guys were offended,” Timberlake later claimed at the Grammy Awards . less Janet Jackson and Justin Timberlake
During the performance, the “Cry Me a River” singer supposedly accidentally ripped his fellow performer’s outfit, exposing her breast to the crowd in a mishap later ... more Photo: National Geographic Channels Image 11 of 15 Beyoncé
Though her 2016 performance may have inspired far more social media outrage, her 2013 performance was plenty memorable, as she wooed the crowd with “Crazy in Love” and newer tunes like “Love on Top.” less Beyoncé
Though her 2016 performance may have inspired far more social media outrage, her 2013 performance was plenty memorable, as she wooed the crowd with “Crazy in Love” and newer tunes like “Love on ... more Photo: Charlie Riedel, STF Image 12 of 15 Beyoncé
For true Queen Bey fans, the best part was the on-stage Destiny’s Child reunion when the trio’s other former stars -- Michelle Williams and Kelly Rowland -- popped up to sing “Independent Woman.” less Beyoncé
For true Queen Bey fans, the best part was the on-stage Destiny’s Child reunion when the trio’s other former stars -- Michelle Williams and Kelly Rowland -- popped up to sing “Independent ... more Photo: Christopher Polk, Staff Image 13 of 15 Coldplay
Although Coldplay was the featured performer, it was Beyoncé who stole the show . Her politically charged #BlackLivesMatter-inspired performance of her new song “Formation” drew buckets of praise and criticism on social media afterward. less Coldplay
Although Coldplay was the featured performer, it was Beyoncé who stole the show . Her politically charged #BlackLivesMatter-inspired performance of her new song “Formation” drew buckets of praise ... more Photo: Charlie Riedel, AP Image 14 of 15 Coldplay
Queen Bey has established a reputation as a stellar performer, and her 2016 Super Bowl appearance was no exception. Oh, and Coldplay and Bruno Mars offered Beyoncé good background singers and dancers. less Coldplay
Queen Bey has established a reputation as a stellar performer, and her 2016 Super Bowl appearance was no exception. Oh, and Coldplay and Bruno Mars offered Beyoncé good background singers and ... more Photo: Patrick Smith, Getty Images Image 15 of 15 Lady Gaga landed cool place to stay in Houston 1 / 15 Back to Gallery When it comes to Super Bowl landing spots, Lady Gaga scored a touchdown.
Lady Gaga, who will perform at halftime on Sunday, has reportedly been staying at a home with a listed sale price of $7,495,000.
And, if short-term stay is more in the budget, the monthly rate is $45,059.
JOHN LEGEND: Singer has busy Super Bowl weekend in Houston
About magazine describes the home as " classically-styled, custom-built residence by Robert Dame features curated finishes and authentic details. Sadly, Gaga not included."
Sad indeed. She would probably make an interesting roommate for Super Bowl weekend
Of course, for a star who drove around Houston in a black Lamborghini, a multi-million dollar house for a week seems about right.
Lady Gaga will be performing at this year's Super Bowl halftime show in Houston this Sunday which will feature hundreds of lit-up drones. A source told CNNMoney that the drones required clearance from the Federal Aviation Administration which has put a ban on drones at or near the stadium. Earlier in the week the Federal Aviation Administration stated a 34.5-mile radius around the Houston stadium and stated that it is a "no drone zone" on the day of the game.
Media: Brandpoint >>>Click through the gallery above to see more photos of Lady Gaga's temporary home while in Houston, as well as her modeling career and memorable halftime Super Bowl shows.
